page.title: 17MOORSIDE EDGE TRANSMITTER.
page.content: The Moorside Edge radio transmitter was opened on May 17th.1931.It stands in 35 acres of moorland bought from the Dartmouth Estate.Originally it broadcast the Home and North Regional Service to much of Northern England and was Britain's largest transmitter. As the site is 330 metres above sea-level and the twin masts rise to 150 metres,they can be seen from many miles away.These masts are built on huge concrete pivots to allow for swing in windy conditions.In 1984 the masts were repositioned so the signals would cover the required area more satisfactorily.Both masts now transmit Radio 2.Parallel wires down each side transmit Radio 1 and 3 to Yorkshire, Lancashire,Cheshire,Cumbria,Durham, Lincolnshire,Derbyshire,Staffordshire and North Wales.By 1990,the station will be unmanned and fully automatic.
